articles.title: DPRK Sends Illegal Japanese Entrant Back to Japan
articles.content:
DPRK Sends Illegal Japanese Entrant Back to Japan 
    Pyongyang, August 25 (KCNA) -- Japanese citizen Masahiro Sekiguchi illegally entered the DPRK on June 7.
 According to an investigation conducted by a relevant institution, he had lived in Meiwa village, Ora County, Gunma Prefecture, Japan. Harassed by a family affair, he went to Germany on January 6 and asked for refuge there. But his request was turned down and he was transferred to the Japanese embassy to return to his country.
 Seeking again for refuge, he left Japan on May 25 and arrived in JiAn City, Jilin Province, China. From there he swam across the River Amnok to reach Mitha-ri, Manpho City, Jagang Province of the DPRK.    
 It has been confirmed that he illegally entered the DPRK solely for his personal reason, not for any sinister political purpose. Taking his intention into consideration, too, the DPRK, therefore, sent him back to his country on Aug. 24 from a humanitarian point of view.

articles.title: DPRK Book, Photo and Handicraft Exhibition Visited by Foreigners
articles.content:
DPRK Book, Photo and Handicraft Exhibition Visited by Foreigners 
    Pyongyang, August 25 (KCNA) -- A DPRK book, photo and handicraft exhibition was held in Venezuela from August 9 to 14. It was visited by youth and student delegates of at least 100 countries, including the general secretary of the World Federation of Democratic Youth, the chairman of the Algerian Peace Association, the international secretary of the Communist Youth of Greece, the national coordinator of the Brazilian October 8 Revolutionary Youth, members of international and regional organizations, citizens of Caracas and Koreans in Americas, more than 30,000 in all. 
 Displayed there were a photograph of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il discussing work and photos of  Kim Jong Il inspecting units of the Korean People's Army and guiding the work in various fields of national economy and the youth work. Also displayed there were their famous works and Korean books and handicrafts.
 The general secretary of the World Federation of Democratic Youth and other visitors said that the DPRK, though small in population and territory, is prevailing over the U.S. styling itself the world's "only superpower" because it has a powerful military strength which the U.S. cannot overpower.    
 Under the outstanding leadership of Kim Il Sung 50 odd years ago the Korean people defeated the U.S. imperialists, demonstrating the might of the DPRK to humankind, and are now making dynamic advance, shattering the U.S. persistent moves to blockade, isolate and stifle the DPRK under the leadership of Kim Jong Il, they said, adding that no force on earth can break the steadfast faith of the Korean people and youth in the victory of socialism and the might of their single-minded unity around their leader.
 They expressed conviction that the Korean people would certainly build a great prosperous powerful socialist nation, true to the Songun leadership of Kim Jong Il.

Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Start of Songun Leadership Marked
articles.content:
Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Start of Songun Leadership Marked 
    Pyongyang, August 25 (KCNA) -- An evening gala of the Ministry of the People's Armed Forces took place at Jonsung Square Wednesday to celebrate the 45th anniversary of Supreme Commander Kim Jong Il's start of Songun revolutionary leadership.
 Amid the playing of "Our General Is Best", "Let's Sing of Our Pride in Being under the Guidance of the General" and other songs, servicepersons danced, recalling with deep emotion the 45 year-long history of the Songun revolution made by Kim Jong Il, who has trained the People's Army into a matchless ever-victorious revolutionary strong army and led the revolutionary cause of Juche to victory.    
 Dancing to the tune of "Songun Nilliri", "Let's Keep Step to Military Song" and other songs, they renewed their determination to firmly defend the prosperity and development of the socialist motherland and the happiness of the people with arms of Songun, fluttering the flags of the supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, the WPK and the DPRK.    
 Present at the gala were Jo Myong Rok, director of the General Political Department of the KPA, Kim Yong Chun, chief of the KPA General Staff, Kim Il Chol, minister of the People's Armed Forces, leading officials of the ministry, officers and men of the KPA.
 Meanwhile, a music and dance performance "We Will Uphold the Great Songun Brilliant Commander with Arms" was given at the April 25 House of Culture on the same day by the KPA Song and Dance Ensemble on that occasion. 
 It was appreciated by Kim Yong Chun, Kim Il Chol, leading officials of the ministry and officers and men of the KPA.

articles.title: WPK Anniversary to Be Marked in Brazil
articles.content:
WPK Anniversary to Be Marked in Brazil 
    Pyongyang, August 25 (KCNA) -- A Brazilian preparatory committee was formed in Sao Paulo on Aug. 9 to celebrate the 60th founding anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea.
 At its inaugural ceremony, Nilson Araujo de Souza, chairman of the Brazil-Korea Friendship Association, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
 The preparatory committee decided to organize colorful functions on that occasion.

Arirang Extravaganza Draws Capacity Audience Everyday
articles.content:
Arirang Extravaganza Draws Capacity Audience Everyday
    Pyongyang, August 25 (KCNA) -- The grand gymnastic and artistic performance "Arirang" has drawn nearly 300,000 people in the capital and local areas since its significant premiere was given on August 16 on the occasion of the 60th anniversary of the liberation of Korea. 
 The wishes of people to watch it are growing stronger as the days go by.
 Informed of those wishes, leader Kim Jong Il took benevolent measures to ensure that those trains operating between Pyongyang and Sinuiju, Manpho, Hyesan, Chongjin and other areas offer special coach service for those who travel to the capital city to watch Arirang and bus service is provided for those traveling for the same purpose from the areas not far away from it such as South Phyongan and North Hwanghae provinces.
 As a result, this special bus service began on August 22 for travelers from Phyongsong, Nampho, Anju, Kaechon and other areas and the first train with coaches called "For Arirang Audience Only" left Sinuiju and arrived here on August 24.

S. Korean Performing Troupe and Visiting Group Leave
articles.content:
S. Korean Performing Troupe and Visiting Group Leave
    Pyongyang, August 25 (KCNA) -- The performing troupe including singer Jo Yong Phil and a visiting group including President of SBS Yun Se Yong and lawmakers of south Korea left here Thursday after visiting Pyongyang on the invitation of the National Reconciliation Council of the north.
 They were seen off at the airport by Ri Jong Hyok, vice-chairman of the Korea Asia-Pacific Peace Committee, and Pak Kyong Chol, vice-chairman of the National Reconciliation Council, and officials concerned.    
 During the stay some of the group visited different parts of the capital and local areas.

articles.title: Talks Held between KSDP and DWP of S. Korea
articles.content:
Talks Held between KSDP and DWP of S. Korea
    Pyongyang, August 25 (KCNA) -- Talks were held between the delegations of the Korean Social Democratic Party and the Democratic Workers' Party of south Korea at the People's Palace of Culture on August 25.
 Present at the talks from the north side were Chairman Kim Yong Dae and officials of the KSDP Central Committee and from the south side members of the DWP delegation headed by Kim Hye Gyong, representative of the party.    
 At the talks both sides exchanged views on the issue of developing the ties of solidarity and cooperation between them for national reunification and matters of mutual concern.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets South Korean Party Delegation
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets South Korean Party Delegation
    Pyongyang, August 25 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met the delegation of the Democratic Workers' Party of south Korea led by Kim Hye Gyong, representative of the party, and conversed with it in a compatriotic atmosphere at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Thursday.
 On hand were Mun Pyong Rok, vice-chairman of the Central Committee of the Korean Social Democratic Party, and officials concerned.

Congratulations to President of Guinea-Bissau
articles.content:
Congratulations to President of Guinea-Bissau
    Pyongyang, August 25 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Wednesday sent a congratulatory message to Joao Bernardo Vieira upon his election as president of Guinea-Bissau.
 Expressing the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger in the future, Kim in the message sincerely wished the president of Guinea-Bissau great success in his responsible work for peace and stability of the country and its socio-economic development.
